DESCRIPTION:THE URBAN WATERS FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP SEEKS TO COORDINATE AND FACILITATE ON-THE-GROUND PROJECTS IN THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE (ALBUQUERQUE, NM) THAT ARE CRITICAL TO IMPROVING WATER QUALITY AND PUBLIC HEALTH IN URBAN WATERSHEDS.  FOR THIS CRITICAL WORK TO OCCUR, AN URBAN WATERS AMBASSADOR IS NEEDED TO SUPPORT THIS EFFORT.  CIUDAD SOIL AND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT WILL USE THESE FUNDS TO HIRE AND MAINTAIN THE URBAN WATERS AMBASSADORACTIVITIES:THE URBAN WATERS AMBASSADOR FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE URBANIZED AREA WILL COORDINATE ACTIVITIES THAT:
1. CONNECT FEDERAL TOOLS AND RESOURCES WITH THE NEEDS OF THE ALBUQUERQUE URBANIZED AREA
2.  SERVE AS A CATALYST TO ENSURE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE ON-THE-GROUND PROJECTS IN THE ALBUQUERQUE URBANIZED AREA
3.  BUILD AND MAINTAIN PARTNERSHIPS WITH FEDERAL, STATE, TRIBAL, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, NON-PROFIT AND LOCAL GRASSROOTS ORGANIZATIONS THAT WILL SERVE AS A FOUNDATION FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE URBAN WATERS FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM
4.  COMMUNICATE WITH OTHER URBAN WATERS AMBASSADORS TO SHARE COMMON EXPERIENCES AND KNOWLEDGE NECESSARY TO HELP RESTORE THE RIO GRANDESUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE BENEFICIARY(IES) OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE (ALBUQUERQUE, NM) URBAN AREAS.

OUTCOMES INCLUDE:
1. SUSTAINABILITY OF THE URBAN WATERS PROGRAM AND SPECIFICALLY OF THE AMBASSADOR POSITION
2. INCREASED PARTICIPATION IN THE URBAN WATERS FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP AND STEERING COMMITTEE AND ACTIVELY INVITE STAKEHOLDERS NOT YET INVOLVED TO PARTICIPATE
    A. CREATE REGULAR IN-PERSON EVENTS SUCH AS TOURS OR SITE VISITS THAT INCLUDE UNSTRUCTURED NETWORKING TIME.  ENCOURAGE RELATIONSHIP-BUILDING AMONG PARTNER AND OFFER MORE 
        OPPORTUNITIES  TO ENGAGE WITH THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE URBAN WATERS FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP 
3. CONTINUE TO DEVELOP AND HONE THE PARTNERSHIP'S GOALS AND THEMES
4. CONTINUE TO DEVELOP AND IMPROVE THE FORMAT OF PARTNERSHIP MEETINGS 
5.  EXPLORE METHODS FOR TRACKING OUTCOMES
6.  DEVELOP A STANDARD FORM CATALOG OF PAST, PRESENT AND FUTURE URBAN WATERS PROJECTS
     A. DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A LOCAL PARTNERSHIP WEBSITE

DELIVERABLE
SUBMIT QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS TO THE EPA PROJECT OFFICER
THE SEWERAGE AND WATER BOARD OF NEW ORLEANS WILL COLLECT, ANALYZE, AND COMMUNICATE DATA ON THE EFFECTS OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE  INSTALLATIONS ON THE

THE PROJECT WILL HELP STAKEHOLDERS ADDRESS THE PLAN TO 'RESTORE WARMWATER FISH AND MACROINVERTEBRATE COMMUNITIES SO THAT ALL WATERWAYS MEET THEIR AQUATIC LIFE USE DESIGNATIONS WITH NATURAL WATERWAYS MAINTAINING AT LEAST A GOOD INTEGRITY CLASS RATING' BY REDUCING SEDIMENT AND NUTRIENT LOADING TO DEEP RIVER BY PERMANENTLY CONVERTING APPROXIMATELY 42 ACRES OF ROW CROP AGRICULTURAL LAND BACK TO NATURAL LAND COVER.

THE TOLEDO METROPOLITAN AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (TMACOG) WILL FOCUS ON OUTREACH EFFORTS WITH STUDENTS FROM THE AREA FOR STUDENT WATERSHED WATCH (SWW) ACTIVITIES DAYS. TMACOG AND ITS PARTNERS WILL TEACH STUDENTS HOW TO TEST THE QUALITY OF AREA WATERWAYS. IN ADDITION, TMACOG WILL ESTABLISH AN ONLINE HUB FOR THE SWW WHERE THE DATA COLLECTED DURING THE ACTIVITIES DAYS WILL BE HOUSED AND ANALYZED.

THE DUNES LEARNING CENTER PROJECT WILL ENGAGE MORE THAN 3,000 YOUTH AND 100 TEACHERS TO IMPROVE SCHOOL PERFORMANCE, CULTIVATE A STEWARDSHIP ETHIC AND CREATE PATHWAYS TO PURSUE EDUCATIONAL AND CAREER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE OUTDOORS.  DUNES LEARNING CENTER WILL UTILIZE ESTABLISHED CONNECTIONS WITH LOCAL SCHOOLS, TEACHERS AND PARTNERS TO SCHEDULE CANOEMOBILE EVENTS.  CANOEMOBILE IS A 'FLOATING CLASSROOM' THAT GETS STUDENTS OUT ON LOCAL WATERWAYS IN 24-FOOT VOYAGEUR CANOES CONNECTING STUDENTS WITH THEIR LOCAL WATERWAYS SO THEY BETTER UNDERSTAND HOW THEIR ACTIONS IMPACT THE LAKE MICHIGAN WATERSHED.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $15,000 TO GROUNDWORK ATLANTA WHICH WILL ENABLE THEM, BY DIRECT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, THE ABILITY TO PROMOTE A WATERSHED ALLIANCE WITHIN THE PROCTOR CREEK WATERSHED THROUGH EDUCATION, PLANNING AND CREATION OF A STEWARDSHIP GROUP OF LOCAL HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, A GREEN TEAM, THAT WILL MAINTAIN PUBLIC ACCESSIBILITY OF CREEK SIDE TRAILS AND MAINTAIN PROPOSED BANDALONG LITTER TRAPS IN PROCTOR CREEK.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $20,000 TO WEST ATLANTA WATERSHED ALLIANCE TO PROMOTE WATERSHED STEWARDSHIP THROUGH EDUCATION AND DIRECT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT WITHIN THE PROCTOR CREEK WATERSHED.
THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,000 TO THE WEST ATLANTA WATERSHED ALLIANCE, INC. WHICH SUPPORTS THE 4TH YEAR OF A 5-YEAR PROCTOR CREEK IMPROVEMENT PLAN.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $15,000 TO ENVIRONMENTAL COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. WHICH SUPPORTS THE DEVELOPMENT OF CONTENT FOR THE PROPOSED PROCTOR CREEK STORYMAP. ECO-ACTION WILL COORDINATE COMMUNITY MEMBER ACTIVITIES TO GATHER INFORMATION ON COMPLETED, PLANNED AND PROPOSED GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS AT APPROXIMATELY 10 SITES THAT ARE REPRESENTATIVE OF THE WATERSHED.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $59,995 TO THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE TO SUPPORT A COMMUNITY DRIVEN EFFORT. THIS URBAN WATERS PROJECT
